meanings.definition: A localized area of necrosis resulting from obstruction of the blood supply.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the infarct on the X-ray.
meanings.sent2: The infarct in his heart was causing him pain.
meanings.sent3: The infarct seemed like a tiny graveyard for cells.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of becoming a dancer faced an infarct when she injured her foot.
meanings.sent5: The infarct was like a dark shadow on his health report.

meanings.sent1: The tissue began to infarct due to lack of oxygen.
meanings.sent2: He feared his heart might infarct under stress.
meanings.sent3: The cake started to infarct in the oven, turning into a burnt mess.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes for a promotion infarcted when she made a critical mistake.
meanings.sent5: The plant infarcted after being overwatered, wilting away.
